page.title: 17The Craigs, Torphichen
page.content: The Craigs is a wooded area with grass clearings, of approximately 3 acres on the outskirts of Torphichen. It was at one time owned by Mr.William Wolfe who lives overlooking the Craigs and a few years ago he gifted it to the scout movement. The scouts use it as a camp for weekends or longer periods in the summer. They sleep under canvas or in huts which have bunk beds in them and gas lighting. It is also the venue for competions between scout groups. Some weekends scout groups go to the Craigs to take part in improving the area by removing trees damaged by Dutch elm disease, gathering litter, putting red shingle in pot holes in the road and cutting wood in preparation for camp fires and barbecues.
